function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Economic impact of shutting down public spaces in densely populated areas","category":"Business","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global pandemic of covid-19 causing daily loss of lives and economic downturn","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Centralized or de-centralized risk communication management","category":"Leadership","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unrealistic public demands leading to frustration for the government","category":"Leadership","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of expertise and evidence-based decision-making in risk management","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of clarity in government decisions, policies, and important updates","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Shipping problems and supply chain disruptions leading to revenue losses for vendors and small businesses","category":"Business","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Government decision making complexity leading to delays in pandemic response","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Privacy concerns related to tracking super spreaders and individuals for contact tracing","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Psychological impact of prolonged quarantine on mental health","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Investigation of various implemented technologies and their influence in controlling the pandemic.","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Urban wetlands and water bodies provide suitable habitat for bird species, increasing the possibility of disease transmission to human populations","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Vector-borne diseases spread by ectoparasitic organisms on rats , lyme disease, typhus, plague","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Transmission of zoonotic pathogens from urban rats to humans","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Conflicting impact of deer density on tick-borne infections, with some studies suggesting a reduction and others indicating an increase in infections.","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dependency of other tick-borne diseases on the presence of deer, leading to increased risk of transmission and spread.","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Zoonotic tick-borne pathogens in urban areas","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased prevalence of human schistosomiasis from dam constructions","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Presence of sars-cov-2 in human wastewater","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Enteric involvement in hospitalised patients with covid-19","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unavailability of the exact number of covid-19 positive patients","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Immunosuppression in asymptomatic liver transplant recipients","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential enteric transmission of sars-cov-2","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Negative influence on country and destination image due to misinformation and racial references related to covid-19","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dissemination of negative messages through social media may exacerbate country image problems and increase anxiety among tourists.","category":"Participation","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Public concern and criticism of wildlife consumption may lead to heated debates and social unrest, impacting tourism and local communities.","category":"Participation","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Compromised destination image and tourism market due to inappropriate media coverage of the virus’s origins.","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Misleading media coverage of contagious diseases","category":"Participation","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Stigmatization of locations affected by contagious diseases","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inaccurate labeling and misinformation about contagious diseases","category":"Participation","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Social risk related to negative attitudes from friends, family, and associates due to covid-19 travel","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Image risk of a country due to covid-19 outbreak","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Social risk related to negative changes in others’ opinions and attitudes towards travelers in a tourism context","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Vulnerability of affected areas and neighboring countries to crisis events and negative destination image","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Mandatory quarantine measures leading to social isolation and potential mental health implications.","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Study funding without involvement in the study may raise questions about the independence and bias of the research findings.","category":"Accountability","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incomplete disclosure of the funding sources and the lack of involvement may lead to perceptions of conflict of interests or hidden agendas.","category":"Accountability","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential influence of the funding bodies on the dissemination and interpretation of the research findings, despite lack of involvement in the study.","category":"Accountability","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incomplete investigation of shelter-in-place variables for covid-19 spread.","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Positive coefficients for most cities across the country and statistically significant at the 0.01 level, except for the northwestern cities.","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Negative coefficients observed in only a handful of sub-provincial cities and prefecture-level cities, but not statistically significant.","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher coefficients in county-level cities with 36.36% showing the highest coefficient range.","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spatial clustering of variables may indicate localized hotspots of disease transmission or contagion spread.","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Spatial clusters of covid-19 spread indicating high infection ratios in specific regions.","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The large-scale population movement from hubei province via trains increases the risk of disease spread.","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Density of points of interest pois around railway stations increases face-to-face contact and potential disease transmission.","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Population flow from hubei province and number of flights from hubei increase the risk of disease spread between cities.","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Vulnerability of elderly people to covid-19","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Spatial clusters of infection cases","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Concentration of activities around railway stations leading to quick transfer of infected persons to urban areas","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"}]}
